reviews.review_msg: Seminars don't include much new information and most of it is just talking with your peers which doesn't teach you anything. strict on AI but if you do the readings it won't be a problem and you can do well without going to every class if you keep up with readings and uploaded ppts.

This is one of the most engaging classes I've had. Baran is absolutely awesome, very welcoming, a bubbly character, and their lore and research is so interesting. I enjoyed every week of class, and the selected readings and movies were insightful. Take a course with them, I personally felt so transformed.

Take Baran. He's very clear cut and tells you whats expected for the exams (The TAs are responsible for guiding the final essay). At the beginning of the course I didn't think I would really understand the major theories and other main sociological concepts but at the course end I knew much more than I expected myself to know.
Baran is good and seems passionate and interested in material they teach. Easy to do well on exams if you review and understand concepts. Participation in tutorial is part of the mark. Good TAs.

one of the most chill profs u can find in sfu and they really tries to accomodate to every student needs. exams are not hard at all if you go through the concepts in lectures. shout out to patrick for being a great ta as well cuz he explains a lot more of the concepts in tutorials which helped me a lot for studying.
He told me gender is fake
Baranâ€¦ slay!!! The lectures are so fun but also rich and packed with interesting way of using sociology to explain life!!
funny professor who is cool and awesome
i love them fr
There is so much justice in Baran's teaching and the course content! The course is so aware of what's happening globally. With every class, I find what is delievered so timely and needed.

Baran is so fun, caring and puts so much effort in each lecture. Lectures are packed with information, but they share slides in advance that really helps  following them in the lecture. Tutorials are also super fun! I like how real life examples are used making the course material less abstract and easily understandable.

Baran is amazing prof with so much care for students. Example material he provided every week always included memes and content relatable to gen z. The lectures always felt up to date. I loved Baran engaging his research some weeks in the lecture. I wish it could be more, but can understand if it was about some limitations.

Baran was quite opinionated in his lectures and it was pretty clear that he was showing bias when discussing certain topics. This was one of the main drawbacks of the course, as I believe instructors in a professional setting should aim to present information in a more neutral and balanced manner, especially when teaching a subject like sociology.

Baran truly wants you to succeed in the course, and their passion for Sociology radiates in every lecture. For tutorials, show up to each one, ask questions, and contribute to lock in those participation marks. When studying for the exams, I would say to use the textbook effectively, focus on the information that overlaps with the slides.

Baran patiently answered every question I asked about the lectures, exams and the paper through the term. I never felt though he looked down on someone if they asked many questions. They really care about students succeed and they do care about students understanding of the course.

Prof goes on to ramble on random things during lectures, so he doesn't even end up covering the entire slide deck for each lecture. No point in going to the lectures or doing the readings, as you can just study from the lecture slides for tests. Tests are easy and nothing to worry about. Better to connect with TAs as they do all the grading.

Baran is overall a cool person & passionate about sociology. their lectures are made to be relatable for gen z & full of content so i'd recommend going. the extra readings are a bit long. exams are written so you really have to understand the concepts to do well but they're worth as much as the essay & participation which helps balance it out

Baran rocks!!! He's so passionate about what he teaches and cares about the wellbeing of students. He took time to clearly explain assignments. The lectures were always fun, at times packed with many concepts and theories, so took so much energy and commitment to absorb it all. Tutorial participation was 20% so ensure to show up and participate.

Baran executes their lectures in a way that was consistently thought provoking and engaging. At times it was a bit difficult to understand what he was saying when it came to the more complicated topics. Nonetheless, he made this a very enjoyable and interesting class. Make sure to attend lecture cuz there is a lot to catch up on if you miss any.

Love Baran! Their lectures are packed with info, so be prepared to take a lot of notes. The TA's are also amazing! Tutorial participation is with 20% so be sure to show up and contribute! Marked by a midterm, 1 paper, and final. Baron seems very passionate and kind, would recommend taking their class!

Very knowledgeable and good at explaining the course concepts. if you hate the neoliberal ideology of academia then he's such a breath of fresh air. unfortunately the class is 200 people so it's hard to interact w them directly, but he was a great prof. i'd suggest taking a course w smaller ppl to rlly get the best of his teaching.

Good at giving feedback, not too difficult, but way too opinionated. Spoke so heavy on his political views and got very carried away at times, it got super unprofessional. Unnecessarily spoke about these things and it ruined a lot of lectures because he got off track. He was helpful in answering questions about tests, but not professional.
Great lectures! Very informative yet engaging at the same time. He has a great sense of humour and is very passionate about what he teaches.

Baran is an amazing prof who makes an effort to connect with his students! He explains everything clearly, but there's a LOT of content in each class so taking notes can be difficult. The only thing that sucked about this class was the TA's grading... no one understood why we got marks deducted even though we answered everything right. Slay Baran!!
Baran is one of the best SFU has to offer. His lectures are extremely engaging and he makes all concepts and expectations clear. Give this guy a raise!

This course turned out to be one of the best classes I've had. I really like how Baran managed class discussions. though I wish there was more lecture, but overall the course structure and Baran's delivery never left anything unclear or confusing. They love assigning movies, so be ready to watch a good number of them!

I love this sociology class! Baran makes the lectures relevant and interesting to learn. He posts PDF's of the slides and textbook reading is not horrible. Attendance is not mandatory but for tutorial it is. Participation in the tutorial is necessary for a good grade so I recommend attending lectures to participate in conversations for tutorial.
Baran is the nicest prof!!! if you want to like sociology, take his course!!
Baran was a major slay! Would deffo take them again!!!!! No exam queen!!!!!! Gurl do not skip this classssssssss attendance matters slayyyy

Baran is a very knowledgable and passionate prof about his subjects, especially migration. He clearly cares about his subject matter. He is also quite likeable. I also found a lot of justice in his teaching. He is not afraid to call out things as they are I find the structure of his classes a little monotnous but would still take his class again.
Just so good, his lectures are amazing and really draw you in even at 8:30 in the morning. As long as you study his lecture slides, you will be fine for the tests.
Baran is amazing! It was one of best classes I've had and I recommend everyone to take their classes!

Baran is a fantastic lecturer. Their classes were always engaging and easy to follow, and it was clear they truly enjoy working with students and teaching the course. On top of that, Baran is caring, showing genuine concern for each student and offering extra help. They're also very understanding and easy to talk to 10/10 recommend

I mean I haven't read this much for a class, but his class was so fun and engaging. He's available during and out of the classroom and is so caring and accommodating when it's about assignments or help with the course material.

I visited Baran a few times during office hours in the semester or emailed them. Each time they provided very helpful feedback! They seem to be really caring about learning and writing skills of students (I really appreciate all tips on writing). Definitely recommend! Their lecturing content related a lot to my real life experiences.

I would not recommend taking this course with this prof, he is great in lecture with explaination and providing text heavy slides.  However his grading does not reflect your understanding of the course.  I have completed all the readings and attended every lecture/tutorial and studied well but that was not reflected on the midterm - just a warning

Baran is very warm, kind and passionate about what he teaches. His knowledge on the topic of migration and refugees was so impressive and told us stories from his research every week. Sometimes there was too much to read and a good number of films to watch, but they were all so engaging and rich. I highly recommend everyone to go for him

I don't know how professor fakhri got this low review this early in the second week of classes. I'm in the same class and he goes really slow with each slide. I definitely change my rating at the end of the semester seeing how it goes, but so far he seems caring and the lectures are fun

bro asks so many questions in lectures but doesnt let anyone finish their answer just cutting them off like???? then dont ask us idk
he also doesnt really explain things well and speed runs through the slides so you have to wait until the lecture is over to get notes down
